title: Prompt Engineering Foundations
why: The Prompt Engineering Foundations exam is designed to test foundational knowledge and practical prompting skills for those beginning to explore AI tools like ChatGPT. It focuses on prompt refinement, context control, prompt types, temperature/tokens, and common mistakes, enabling learners to use prompting more intentionally and with higher precision.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines prompt engineering?
options: Crafting inputs that guide AI behavior
questions.correctAnswer: Crafting inputs that guide AI behavior

questions.question: Why is it useful to give instructions with context in a prompt?
options: It makes the AI ignore the prompt
It helps AI generate irrelevant answers
It guides AI to give more relevant and focused responses
questions.correctAnswer: It guides AI to give more relevant and focused responses

questions.question: What does a 'role prompt' typically do?
options: Assigns a task to the AI
questions.correctAnswer: Assigns a task to the AI

questions.question: Which prompt is more effective for summarizing text?
options: Summarize the following passage in 3 bullet points.
questions.correctAnswer: Summarize the following passage in 3 bullet points.

questions.question: Which of the following is a 'few-shot prompt' example?
options: Provide 3 examples and then ask the model to continue with another.
Ask the AI to generate a story.
Tell the model to answer a quiz.
questions.correctAnswer: Provide 3 examples and then ask the model to continue with another.

questions.question: What effect does increasing the temperature have?
questions.correctAnswer: Increases randomness and creativity

questions.question: Why is it important to set constraints (e.g., word count, tone) in prompts?
options: To help AI deliver outputs in a desired format
questions.correctAnswer: To help AI deliver outputs in a desired format

questions.question: What is a benefit of specifying the output format in your prompt?
options: Better control over the structure of the answer
questions.correctAnswer: Better control over the structure of the answer

questions.question: What is a common issue with vague prompts?
questions.correctAnswer: They reduce accuracy

questions.question: Which of these is an example of a role-based prompt?
options: You are a professional resume editor. Edit the following resume.
questions.correctAnswer: You are a professional resume editor. Edit the following resume.

questions.question: What is 'token limit' in language models?
options: Maximum response length including prompt and output
questions.correctAnswer: Maximum response length including prompt and output

questions.question: Why might adding examples to a prompt improve performance?
options: It gives AI context for expected output style
questions.correctAnswer: It gives AI context for expected output style

questions.question: What is chain-of-thought prompting used for?
options: Breaking complex tasks into logical steps
questions.correctAnswer: Breaking complex tasks into logical steps

questions.question: Which of these helps refine a prompt for a better response?
questions.correctAnswer: Adding clear instructions and examples

questions.question: Which prompt is most likely to get a creative story?
options: Write a short story about a talking dog that becomes a superhero.
questions.correctAnswer: Write a short story about a talking dog that becomes a superhero.

questions.question: What does temperature=0 typically produce?
questions.correctAnswer: Consistent and focused answers

questions.question: When using a prompt to generate Python code, what is essential to include?
questions.correctAnswer: Language name and task description

questions.question: What makes a prompt iterative?
options: You revise and adjust it over time for better output
questions.correctAnswer: You revise and adjust it over time for better output

questions.question: Which of the following can improve prompt output clarity?
questions.correctAnswer: Breaking instructions into steps

questions.question: Which prompt type is best suited for classification tasks?
options: Binary prompt (e.g., Is this a positive or negative review?)
questions.correctAnswer: Binary prompt (e.g., Is this a positive or negative review?)
